thread.title: Jack Home Joins Worcestershire with a Three-Year Contract
thread.title_full: Jack Home Joins Worcestershire with a Three-Year Contract

author: Jack Bamford
title: Jack Home Joins Worcestershire with a Three-Year Contract
text:
Table of Contents
Toggle
Worcestershire Secures Young Talent Career Milestone for Jack Home Impressive Performance in One-Day Cup Home Expresses His Gratitude Worcestershire Secures Young Talent
Worcestershire County Cricket Club has officially signed pace bowler Jack Home to a three-year contract.
Career Milestone for Jack Home The 18-year-old cricketer has been associated with Worcestershire’s development programs for over ten years. His elevation to the senior team came in July, following a series of injuries that plagued the squad.
Impressive Performance in One-Day Cup Jack Home showcased his talent by participating in five matches during Worcestershire’s 2024 One-Day Cup season, where he made a significant impact by taking 16 wickets.
Home Expresses His Gratitude “To be given the opportunity to play for this club and to sign a three-year contract is a dream come true, and it didn’t take much time to say yes,” Home stated. He also added, “I know I’m not the finished article but I’m very happy with how I performed, with the rewards I’ve been given and how it has all panned out. It couldn’t have gone any better.”
